newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia says June Eurobond tenor to be 7 years.
newsitem.headline: Russia says June Eurobond tenor to be 7 years.

text.p: The Russian Finance Ministry said on Friday the tenor of the next Eurobond to be placed in June will be about seven years.
Earlier a Finance Ministry spokesperson quoted the First Deputy Finance Minister Alexei Kudrin as saying the next Eurobond would have a tenor of between 10 and 20 years.

"Taken into consideration the success of the debut issue of the five-year Russian bond last November, it is expected that the tenor of the next foreign borrowing issue, denominated in U.S. dollars, will be about seven years," a ministry statement said.
